Class amm.http.HTMLEcho

Class amm.http.HTMLEcho 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.awt.Component
           |
           +----java.awt.Container
                   |
                   +----java.awt.Window
                           |
                           +----java.awt.Frame
                                   |
                                   +----amm.http.HTMLEcho
public class HTMLEcho
extends Frame
implements HTTPClient
This class shows a frame that allows the user to enter a URL, plus name/value pairs for POST requests. It will connect to that URL and if the content type is text/html or text/plain it will print the content to the Standard Output.
See Also:
HTTPConnect, HTTPClient

display
The Checkbox that indicates whether status strings should be displayed to the Standard Output.
myContent
The String that holds the content for a POST request.
newName
The TextField used to enter a new Name for POST parameters.
newValue
The TextField used to enter a new Value for POST parameters.
postName
The List that displays the Names for POST parameters.
postValue
The List that displays the Values for POST parameters.
READY
The status string to be displayed when no connections are underway.
rMethod
The Choice that selects the request method.
stat
The Label that displays status messages.
url
The TextField that holds to URL to be retrieved.

HTMLEcho(String)
The constructor simply lays out the Frame by calling arrange(), and show()s it.

abs_path()
This method assumes an absolute URL, and it returns the path of the file on the server, beginning with the first single "/" in the URL.
arrange()
This method simply lays out the Frame.
connect()
This method creates the content (for a POST method), and starts a new HTTPConnect() to actually connect to the HTTP server.
content()
Returns the content - a URLEncoded string from the Name/Value pairs entered by the user.
contentLength()
Returns the content length.
contentType()
Returns the content type - the default Form type.
handleEvent(Event)
If the button is pressed (or the Enter key while typing), this method calls connect().
host()
The host method assumes an absolute URL, and it returns the string between the "//" and the following "/" as the host name.
main(String[])
This starts the application.
method()
Returns the request method selected.
response(String, long, DataInputStream)
If the content type is text/html or text/plain, the content is displayed to the Standard Output.
returnCode(int, String)
This method displays any error messages it encounters, and ignores success messages.
status(String)
This method displays status messages to the status Label at the bottom of the window, and to the Standard Output is the checkbox is set.

READY 
  protected final static String READY
The status string to be displayed when no connections are underway.
url 
  protected TextField url
The TextField that holds to URL to be retrieved.
stat 
  protected Label stat
The Label that displays status messages.

  protected Checkbox display
The Checkbox that indicates whether status strings should be displayed to the Standard Output.

  protected List postName
The List that displays the Names for POST parameters.

  protected TextField newName
The TextField used to enter a new Name for POST parameters.
postValue 
  protected List postValue
The List that displays the Values for POST parameters.
newValue 
  protected TextField newValue
The TextField used to enter a new Value for POST parameters.
rMethod 
  protected Choice rMethod
The Choice that selects the request method.
myContent 
  protected String myContent
The String that holds the content for a POST request.

HTMLEcho 
  public HTMLEcho(String title)
The constructor simply lays out the Frame by calling arrange(), and show()s it.
Parameters:
title - The title of the Frame.
See Also:
arrange

arrange 
  protected void arrange()
This method simply lays out the Frame.
handleEvent 
  public boolean handleEvent(Event evt)
If the button is pressed (or the Enter key while typing), this method calls connect(). Otherwise, it handles the buttons in the window, and so on.
Overrides:
handleEvent in class Component
connect 
  protected void connect()
This method creates the content (for a POST method), and starts a new HTTPConnect() to actually connect to the HTTP server.
See Also:
HTTPConnect
host 
  public String host()
The host method assumes an absolute URL, and it returns the string between the "//" and the following "/" as the host name.
Returns:
The host name.
abs_path 
  public String abs_path()
This method assumes an absolute URL, and it returns the path of the file on the server, beginning with the first single "/" in the URL.
Returns:
The path to the desired file.
method 
  public String method()
Returns the request method selected.
contentType 
  public String contentType()
Returns the content type - the default Form type.
See Also:
MIME_FORM;
contentLength 
  public long contentLength()
Returns the content length.
content 
  public String content()
Returns the content - a URLEncoded string from the Name/Value pairs entered by the user.
See Also:
URLEncoder
status 
  public void status(String line)
This method displays status messages to the status Label at the bottom of the window, and to the Standard Output is the checkbox is set.
response 
  public void response(String cType,
                       long cLength,
                       DataInputStream in)
If the content type is text/html or text/plain, the content is displayed to the Standard Output. Otherwise, it is ignored. Since this method is the last thing called before the connection is closed, it resets the status string before it returns.
returnCode 
  public void returnCode(int code,
                         String desc)
This method displays any error messages it encounters, and ignores success messages.
main 
  public static void main(String args[])
This starts the application. No arguments are necessary.
